title: Bravethug
author: Bravethug
content: I have always been confused about crypto currencies and how they work... how they are stabilised and regulated but with the present plight and constant devaluation of my country's currency, it's safe to say I need to learn, practice and own a safer landing, the banking systems are not helping with constant maintenance levies and network issues. I'm aware that there is no perfect place but anywhere with a more better solution is more preferable. Cheers to the beginning of a new journey.

comments.author: tetaeridanus
comments.body: Hey! Welcome!Good luck on your journey! The more you stay active the more good people you meet! Cheers.Tetaeridanus. ✨

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Bitcoin and many other crypto like the stable coins are helping people in countries with inflation like Turkey, Venezuela and many countries in Africa and Asia. If you know that your government are devaluing your local currency, bitcoin and many other cryptocurrencies is what you can go for. Some people see it easy to buy stable coins as they buy some bitcoin but the best against inflation is bitcoin.The advice that I have for you is to not leave your coins on those centralized exchanges and to protect your noncustodial wallet not to be hacked. If you want a well protected wallet, wallet on airgapped device would be good or buy a hardware wallet.

comments.body: Quote from: Bravethug on September 21, 2023, 11:40:49 AMI have always been confused about crypto currencies and how they work... how they are stabilised and regulated but with the present plight and constant devaluation of my country's currency, it's safe to say I need to learn, practice and own a safer landing, the banking systems are not helping with constant maintenance levies and network issues. I'm aware that there is no perfect place but anywhere with a more better solution is more preferable. Cheers to the beginning of a new journey. The first question that comes to mind is: are you here to learn about Bitcoin so you will be able to making money through it? If yes, do you plan to buy and hold it for a profit or you have figured out other ways of making money from Bitcoin? If your plan is to learn to be able to buy, I will suggest you learn about the DCA method of accumulating BitcoinIn conclusion, If you have the answers to these key questions, then your stay in this forum will be fruitful and you will cherish your the abundant information avialbel here free of charge. So, define your priorities well and have a plan on how to go about it.

comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk forum mate, one of the best ever Bitcoin related discussions forum you will ever find, I am sure you will be happy to be here because you will get almost all the basic guide and knowledge you need about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency here.Quote from: Bravethug on September 21, 2023, 11:40:49 AMI have always been confused about crypto currencies and how they work.. Learnmeabitcoin.com will elaborate and explain almost all the basic information about how Bitcoin works and some knowledge you will need to get started, because knowledge is very important, and considering Bitcoin is a digital currency, you need to have the basic knowledge to avoid some mistakes that might cause you to lose money.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: What exactly do you want to achieve? Want to learn about crypto? or want to invest or trade crypto to earn profits?I'm sure this isn't the first time you've heard of crypto or Bitcoin that attracted you to the forum. If you want to learn everything, start gradually. Don't rush, you can get much information on the forum. But first, determine your goals in the forum and you can filter out some of the more important information.welcome to the forum, maybe you will need more time to search and read. but that's the process. I hope you enjoy it.

The link below will help you with some Bitcoin-related bookshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5350541.0Have it in mind never to store your Bitcoin on a centralized exchanqge like Binance, Gate.io, or Kucoin because you don't have access to the private key where you store your Bitcoin.
